ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Lag Issues
ygData.msgSnippet: I have seen lag all over the place as well.  Not sure what it is  but certain zones brutal, ,especially Emerald Jungle. Be patient I sense we will see this
ygData.messageBody:
I have seen lag all over the place as well. Not sure
what it is but certain zones brutal, ,especially
Emerald Jungle.

Be patient I sense we will see this improve with the
next few patches. Regardless of what Sony says or
does not say, there is something broke. I even
preload the zones, THANK GOD, and it still is slow.

We can only hope

Rob
--- Melanie Johnson <melanie_6602@...> wrote:

> Well, I don't know about Feerrott, but I seem to get
> lag issues after I've had my computer running
> without
> a reboot for a while. And it can happen in zones
> that
> had no lag before. I've not really tried to fix it
> (other than rebooting).
>
> --- Wulfric Rennison <wulftech@...> wrote:
>
> > I'm just wondering if anyone else has been
> > experiencing an inordinate amount of lag lately?
> I
> > mean more than you usually get, even in zones that
> > are unpopulated. For example, whenever I port to
> > the Feerrott, I start lagging immediately, and
> then
> > if I port out, the lag gets even worse, as if I'm
> > carrying it with me. But I had absolutely no lag
> > before I zoned itno Feerrott. So I'm wondering if
> > it's something about that zone?
> >
> > And before you say it's my computer system, I am
> > running a Pentium 4 1.8Ghz with 1 GB of RAM, and a
> > 128MB ATI Radeon 9200 video card. I also have a
> > cable modem connection. And as I said, there's no
> > lag until I zone into Feerrott.
> >
> > Before you ask if I have anything running in the
> > background, I use this system for nothing but
> > Everquest, so I have already gone ahead and shut
> > down all the background programs.
> >
> > Before you ask if I have checked EQ's
> knowledgebase,
> > I've already done everythign they've reccomended
> and
> > it hasn't solved the problem. One thing I did
> find
> > out was that certain zones will lag becasue on ATI
> > cards there's an option for Wait For Vertical
> Sync,
> > and they reccomend setting it to Off. So I did
> > this, but now I'm getting lag in EVERY zone so I
> > really don't think that's it.
> >
> > And before you ask if I have updated to the latest
> > video drivers, I did that when I found out about
> the
> > Vertical Sync issue.
> >
> > As you can probably tell, I'm not without some
> > troubleshooting knowledge, but I've done
> everything
> > I can think of, and the problem is still
> persisting.
> > The one clue I have is that the problem didn't
> > start happening until after last patch. So I
> don't
> > know if that has anything to do with it. I
> thought
> > I would check and see if anyone else is having
> this
> > problem.
> >
> > Thanks
> >
> > Wulfric
> > Cazic Thule server
> >
> > PS, I can duplicate this problem on any server
> with
> > any character.
> > PPS Yes I have already filled out several bug
> reports.
>
>
> =====
> ~~~~~~~~~
>
> And on the eighth day God said, "O.K. Murphy. You
> take over."
> http://home.comcast.net/~melanieroark
>
>
